title: Reformat Department Table
question_content:
Table: Department

+-------------+---------+
| Column Name | Type    |
+-------------+---------+
| id          | int     |
| revenue     | int     |
| month       | varchar |
+-------------+---------+
In SQL,(id, month) is the primary key of this table.
The table has information about the revenue of each department per month.
The month has values in ["Jan","Feb","Mar","Apr","May","Jun","Jul","Aug","Sep","Oct","Nov","Dec"].

 

Reformat the table such that there is a department id column and a revenue column for each month.

Return the result table in any order.

The result format is in the following example.

 

Example 1:

Input: 
Department table:
+------+---------+-------+
| id   | revenue | month |
+------+---------+-------+
| 1    | 8000    | Jan   |
| 2    | 9000    | Jan   |
| 3    | 10000   | Feb   |
| 1    | 7000    | Feb   |
| 1    | 6000    | Mar   |
+------+---------+-------+
Output: 
+------+-------------+-------------+-------------+-----+-------------+
| id   | Jan_Revenue | Feb_Revenue | Mar_Revenue | ... | Dec_Revenue |
+------+-------------+-------------+-------------+-----+-------------+
| 1    | 8000        | 7000        | 6000        | ... | null        |
| 2    | 9000        | null        | null        | ... | null        |
| 3    | null        | 10000       | null        | ... | null        |
+------+-------------+-------------+-------------+-----+-------------+
Explanation: The revenue from Apr to Dec is null.
Note that the result table has 13 columns (1 for the department id + 12 for the months).

solutions.title: mssql-multiple-joins-groupby-and-pivot-table-solutions
solutions.content:
**Multiple left joins**
```
;WITH ids AS 
(
    SELECT DISTINCT id FROM Department
)
SELECT 
    ids.id, 
    d_jan.revenue AS Jan_Revenue,
    d_feb.revenue AS Feb_Revenue,
    d_mar.revenue AS Mar_Revenue,
    d_apr.revenue AS Apr_Revenue,
    d_may.revenue AS May_Revenue,
    d_jun.revenue AS Jun_Revenue,
    d_jul.revenue AS Jul_Revenue,
    d_aug.revenue AS Aug_Revenue,
    d_sep.revenue AS Sep_Revenue,
    d_oct.revenue AS Oct_Revenue,
    d_nov.revenue AS Nov_Revenue,
    d_dec.revenue AS Dec_Revenue
FROM ids
LEFT JOIN Department d_jan ON d_jan.id = ids.id AND d_jan.month = 'Jan'
LEFT JOIN Department d_feb ON d_feb.id = ids.id AND d_feb.month = 'Feb'
LEFT JOIN Department d_mar ON d_mar.id = ids.id AND d_mar.month = 'Mar'
LEFT JOIN Department d_apr ON d_apr.id = ids.id AND d_apr.month = 'Apr'
LEFT JOIN Department d_may ON d_may.id = ids.id AND d_may.month = 'May'
LEFT JOIN Department d_jun ON d_jun.id = ids.id AND d_jun.month = 'Jun'
LEFT JOIN Department d_jul ON d_jul.id = ids.id AND d_jul.month = 'Jul'
LEFT JOIN Department d_aug ON d_aug.id = ids.id AND d_aug.month = 'Aug'
LEFT JOIN Department d_sep ON d_sep.id = ids.id AND d_sep.month = 'Sep'
LEFT JOIN Department d_oct ON d_oct.id = ids.id AND d_oct.month = 'Oct'
LEFT JOIN Department d_nov ON d_nov.id = ids.id AND d_nov.month = 'Nov'
LEFT JOIN Department d_dec ON d_dec.id = ids.id AND d_dec.month = 'Dec'
```


**Group by solution**
```
SELECT 
    id, 
    MAX(CASE WHEN month = 'Jan' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS Jan_Revenue,
    MAX(CASE WHEN month = 'Feb' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS Feb_Revenue,
    MAX(CASE WHEN month = 'Mar' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS Mar_Revenue,
    MAX(CASE WHEN month = 'Apr' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS Apr_Revenue,
    MAX(CASE WHEN month = 'May' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS May_Revenue,
    MAX(CASE WHEN month = 'Jun' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS Jun_Revenue,
    MAX(CASE WHEN month = 'Jul' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS Jul_Revenue,
    MAX(CASE WHEN month = 'Aug' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS Aug_Revenue,
    MAX(CASE WHEN month = 'Sep' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS Sep_Revenue,
    MAX(CASE WHEN month = 'Oct' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS Oct_Revenue,
    MAX(CASE WHEN month = 'Nov' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS Nov_Revenue,
    MAX(CASE WHEN month = 'Dec' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS Dec_Revenue
FROM Department
GROUP BY id
```


**Pivot table solution**
```
SELECT 
    id,
    Jan AS Jan_Revenue,
    Feb AS Feb_Revenue, 
    Mar AS Mar_Revenue, 
    Apr AS Apr_Revenue,
    May AS May_Revenue,
    Jun AS Jun_Revenue,
    Jul AS Jul_Revenue,
    Aug AS Aug_Revenue,
    Sep AS Sep_Revenue,
    Oct AS Oct_Revenue,
    Nov AS Nov_Revenue,
    Dec AS Dec_Revenue
FROM Department
PIVOT 
(
    MAX(revenue)
    FOR month IN (Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec)        
) AS MonthsRevenue
```

solutions.title: simple-mysql-solution-using-if-and-sum
solutions.content:
```
SELECT id,
       SUM(if(month = 'Jan', revenue, null)) AS Jan_Revenue,
       SUM(if(month = 'Feb', revenue, null)) AS Feb_Revenue,
       SUM(if(month = 'Mar', revenue, null)) AS Mar_Revenue,
       SUM(if(month = 'Apr', revenue, null)) AS Apr_Revenue,
       SUM(if(month = 'May', revenue, null)) AS May_Revenue,
       SUM(if(month = 'Jun', revenue, null)) AS Jun_Revenue,
       SUM(if(month = 'Jul', revenue, null)) AS Jul_Revenue,
       SUM(if(month = 'Aug', revenue, null)) AS Aug_Revenue,
       SUM(if(month = 'Sep', revenue, null)) AS Sep_Revenue,
       SUM(if(month = 'Oct', revenue, null)) AS Oct_Revenue,
       SUM(if(month = 'Nov', revenue, null)) AS Nov_Revenue,
       SUM(if(month = 'Dec', revenue, null)) AS Dec_Revenue
FROM Department
GROUP BY id
```

**IF()**
`IF(condition, if_true, if_false)`
condition - If month is equal to the respective column (for Jan_revenue column it should be `month = 'Jan'`)
if_true= return all the **list of values** with respect to the individual id, afterwards we will sum all the values in the next step.
if_false - Just return **NULL** id there is no revenure with respect to that ID and the month.

**SUM()**
We sum all the values of respective id per month and then return it in the front of that id in the respective month column.
SUM(will sum all the values under the conidtion in this bracket)

**Why I have used Group By and SUM?**
For same id, month value can be repeated. Sum function will add all those to display in single row as `group by id` is used ((not month).

Please **Upvote** if you like the solution.

solutions.title: very-easy-oracle-pivot-solution
solutions.content:
```
SELECT *
  FROM department
       PIVOT (SUM (revenue)
             Revenue
             FOR month
             IN ('Jan' Jan,
                'Feb' Feb,
                'Mar' Mar,
                'Apr' Apr,
                'May' May,
                'Jun' Jun,
                'Jul' Jul,
                'Aug' Aug,
                'Sep' Sep,
                'Oct' Oct,
                'Nov' Nov,
                'Dec' Dec));
````

solutions.title: ms-sql-server-simple-pivot-solution
solutions.content:
```
SELECT *
FROM (
    SELECT id, CONCAT(month,'_Revenue') col_name, revenue
    FROM Department
) as Dpt
PIVOT (
    SUM(revenue)
    FOR col_name IN ("Jan_Revenue", "Feb_Revenue", "Mar_Revenue", "Apr_Revenue", "May_Revenue", "Jun_Revenue", "Jul_Revenue", "Aug_Revenue", "Sep_Revenue", "Oct_Revenue", "Nov_Revenue", "Dec_Revenue")
) pivot_table
```

solutions.title: mysql-solution-for-reformat-department-table-problem
solutions.content:
# Intuition
<!-- Describe your first thoughts on how to solve this problem. -->
The given SQL query aims to retrieve the monthly revenue for each department by summing the revenue for each month. It uses conditional aggregation and the GROUP BY clause to calculate the revenue for each department.

# Approach
<!-- Describe your approach to solving the problem. -->
1. The query selects the department ID (id) and calculates the sum of revenue for each month using conditional aggregation.
1. The IF function is used to conditionally include the revenue value based on the month. If the month matches the specified month, the revenue is included; otherwise, it is set to null.
1. The revenue for each month is labeled with corresponding aliases (Jan_Revenue, Feb_Revenue, ..., Dec_Revenue).
1. The query groups the rows by department ID using the GROUP BY clause.
1. The result is a set of rows, where each row represents a department ID along with the monthly revenues.

# Complexity
- Time complexity:
<!-- Add your time complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->
The time complexity of the query depends on the size of the "Department" table, the number of distinct departments, and the efficiency of the database's query execution plan. The query requires scanning the entire "Department" table, grouping the rows by department ID, and calculating the conditional sums for each month. The time complexity can vary, but it typically ranges from linear to quadratic based on the number of rows and the efficiency of index usage.

- Space complexity:
<!-- Add your space complexity here, e.g. $$O(n)$$ -->
The space complexity of the query depends on the size of the result set, which is determined by the number of distinct departments in the "Department" table. The space required to store the result grows linearly with the number of departments.

# Code
```
# Write your MySQL query statement below
select
id,
sum(if(month = 'Jan', revenue, null)) as Jan_Revenue,
sum(if(month = 'Feb', revenue, null)) as Feb_Revenue,
sum(if(month = 'Mar', revenue, null)) as Mar_Revenue,
sum(if(month = 'Apr', revenue, null)) as Apr_Revenue,
sum(if(month = 'May', revenue, null)) as May_Revenue,
sum(if(month = 'Jun', revenue, null)) as Jun_Revenue,
sum(if(month = 'Jul', revenue, null)) as Jul_Revenue,
sum(if(month = 'Aug', revenue, null)) as Aug_Revenue,
sum(if(month = 'Sep', revenue, null)) as Sep_Revenue,
sum(if(month = 'Oct', revenue, null)) as Oct_Revenue,
sum(if(month = 'Nov', revenue, null)) as Nov_Revenue,
sum(if(month = 'Dec', revenue, null)) as Dec_Revenue
from Department
group by id;
```

solutions.title: ms-sql-answer-for-beginner
solutions.content:
``` SQL
SELECT T.id, 
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'Jan' AND T.id = id) AS 'Jan_Revenue',
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'Feb' AND T.id = id) AS 'Feb_Revenue',
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'Mar' AND T.id = id) AS 'Mar_Revenue',
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'Apr' AND T.id = id) AS 'Apr_Revenue',
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'May' AND T.id = id) AS 'May_Revenue',
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'Jun' AND T.id = id) AS 'Jun_Revenue',
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'Jul' AND T.id = id) AS 'Jul_Revenue',
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'Aug' AND T.id = id) AS 'Aug_Revenue',
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'Sep' AND T.id = id) AS 'Sep_Revenue',
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'Oct' AND T.id = id) AS 'Oct_Revenue',
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'Nov' AND T.id = id) AS 'Nov_Revenue',
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'Dec' AND T.id = id) AS 'Dec_Revenue'
FROM (
    SELECT DISTINCT id
    FROM Department
) AS T;
```

## Explain

1. Get all non-duplicate id 

`SELECT DISTINCT id FROM Department`

| id |
|----|
| 1  |
| 2  |
| 3  |

2. Use subquery in `SELECT` to get `revenue` for each month

``` SQL
SELECT 
	T.id, 
    ( SELECT revenue FROM Department WHERE month = 'Jan' AND T.id = id) AS 'Jan_Revenue'
FROM (
    SELECT DISTINCT id
    FROM Department
) AS T;
```

| id | Jan_Revenue |
|----|-------------|
| 1  | 8000        |
| 2  | 9000        |
| 3  | null        |

## Reference

- [SQL Subquery](https://www.dofactory.com/sql/subquery#example)

solutions.title: mysql-left-joins
solutions.content:
Simply left joining every month

```
select 
t0.id,
t1.revenue as Jan_Revenue,
t2.revenue as Feb_Revenue,
t3.revenue as Mar_Revenue,
t4.revenue as Apr_Revenue,
t5.revenue as May_Revenue,
t6.revenue as Jun_Revenue,
t7.revenue as Jul_Revenue,
t8.revenue as Aug_Revenue,
t9.revenue as Sep_Revenue,
t10.revenue as Oct_Revenue,
t11.revenue as Nov_Revenue,
t12.revenue as Dec_Revenue
from Department t0
left join Department t1 on t0.id = t1.id and t1.month = 'Jan'
left join Department t2 on t0.id = t2.id and t2.month = 'Feb'
left join Department t3 on t0.id = t3.id and t3.month = 'Mar'
left join Department t4 on t0.id = t4.id and t4.month = 'Apr'
left join Department t5 on t0.id = t5.id and t5.month = 'May'
left join Department t6 on t0.id = t6.id and t6.month = 'Jun'
left join Department t7 on t0.id = t7.id and t7.month = 'Jul'
left join Department t8 on t0.id = t8.id and t8.month = 'Aug'
left join Department t9 on t0.id = t9.id and t9.month = 'Sep'
left join Department t10 on t0.id = t10.id and t10.month = 'Oct'
left join Department t11 on t0.id = t11.id and t11.month = 'Nov'
left join Department t12 on t0.id = t12.id and t12.month = 'Dec'
GROUP BY t0.id
```

solutions.title: ms-sql-pivot-table
solutions.content:
```
/* Write your T-SQL query statement below */

select id, 
       Jan as Jan_Revenue,
       Feb as Feb_Revenue,
       Mar as Mar_Revenue,
       Apr as Apr_Revenue,
       May as May_Revenue,
       Jun as Jun_Revenue,
       Jul as Jul_Revenue,
       Aug as Aug_Revenue,
       Sep as Sep_Revenue,
       Oct as Oct_Revenue,
       Nov as Nov_Revenue,
       Dec as Dec_Revenue
from (
    select id, revenue, month
    from department) as department
pivot (
    sum(revenue) 
    for month 
    in (
        "Jan","Feb","Mar","Apr","May","Jun","Jul","Aug","Sep","Oct","Nov","Dec"
    ) 
) as pivot_table
order by id
```

solutions.title: mysql-easy-solution
solutions.content:
```
SELECT d.id as 'id',
      d1.revenue as 'Jan_Revenue',
      d2.revenue as 'feb_Revenue',
      d3.revenue as 'Mar_Revenue',
      d4.revenue as 'Apr_Revenue',
      d5.revenue as 'May_Revenue',
      d6.revenue as 'Jun_Revenue',
      d7.revenue as 'Jul_Revenue',
      d8.revenue as 'Aug_Revenue',
      d9.revenue as 'Sep_Revenue',
      d10.revenue as 'Oct_Revenue',
      d11.revenue as 'Nov_Revenue',
      d12.revenue as 'Dec_Revenue'
FROM Department d
LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM Department WHERE month = 'Jan') d1 on d1.id = d.id
LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM Department WHERE month = 'Feb') d2 on d2.id = d.id
LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM Department WHERE month = 'Mar') d3 on d3.id = d.id
LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM Department WHERE month = 'Apr') d4 on d4.id = d.id
LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM Department WHERE month = 'May') d5 on d5.id = d.id
LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM Department WHERE month = 'Jun') d6 on d6.id = d.id

LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM Department WHERE month = 'Nov') d11 on d11.id = d.id
LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM Department WHERE month = 'Dec') d12 on d12.id = d.id
GROUP BY 1

solutions.title: ms-sql-complicated-solution
solutions.content:
```
/* Write your T-SQL query statement below */

SELECT id as id,
Jan as Jan_Revenue,
Feb as Feb_Revenue,
Mar as Mar_Revenue,
Apr as Apr_Revenue,
May as May_Revenue,
Jun as Jun_Revenue,
Jul as Jul_Revenue,
Aug as Aug_Revenue,
Sep as Sep_Revenue,
Oct as Oct_Revenue,
Nov as Nov_Revenue,
Dec as Dec_Revenue
FROM (
SELECT id, month, revenue
FROM Department
) AS SOURCETABLE PIVOT (
    AVG(revenue)
FOR month IN ([Jan],
        [Feb],
        [Mar],
        [Apr],

        [Jul] ,
        [Aug] ,
        [Sep] ,
        [Oct] ,
        [Nov] ,

/* Write your T-SQL query statement below */

SELECT id as id,
Jan as Jan_Revenue,
Feb as Feb_Revenue,
Mar as Mar_Revenue,
Apr as Apr_Revenue,
May as May_Revenue,
Jun as Jun_Revenue,
Jul as Jul_Revenue,
Aug as Aug_Revenue,
Sep as Sep_Revenue,
Oct as Oct_Revenue,
Nov as Nov_Revenue,
Dec as Dec_Revenue
FROM (
SELECT id, month, revenue
FROM Department
) AS SOURCETABLE PIVOT (
    AVG(revenue)
FOR month IN ([Jan],
        [Feb],
        [Mar],
        [Apr],
        [May],
        [Jun],
        [Jul] ,
        [Aug] ,
        [Sep] ,
        [Oct] ,
        [Nov] ,
        [Dec] )) AS PIVOT_TABLE

solutions.title: simple-of-simple
solutions.content:
```
SELECT 
	id,
    SUM(Jan_Revenue) Jan_Revenue,
    SUM(Feb_Revenue) Feb_Revenue,
    SUM(Mar_Revenue) Mar_Revenue,
    SUM(Apr_Revenue) Apr_Revenue,
    SUM(May_Revenue) May_Revenue,

solutions.title: ansi-compliant-solution-that-works-for-all-3-oracle-mysql-and-mssql
solutions.content:
# Solution 1 (More Elegant and Faster)

```SQL
select
    d.id,
    sum(case when d.month = 'Jan' then d.revenue else null end) "Jan_Revenue",
    sum(case when d.month = 'Feb' then d.revenue else null end) "Feb_Revenue",
    sum(case when d.month = 'Mar' then d.revenue else null end) "Mar_Revenue",
    sum(case when d.month = 'Apr' then d.revenue else null end) "Apr_Revenue",
    sum(case when d.month = 'May' then d.revenue else null end) "May_Revenue",
    sum(case when d.month = 'Jun' then d.revenue else null end) "Jun_Revenue",
    sum(case when d.month = 'Jul' then d.revenue else null end) "Jul_Revenue",
    sum(case when d.month = 'Aug' then d.revenue else null end) "Aug_Revenue",
    sum(case when d.month = 'Sep' then d.revenue else null end) "Sep_Revenue",
    sum(case when d.month = 'Oct' then d.revenue else null end) "Oct_Revenue",
    sum(case when d.month = 'Nov' then d.revenue else null end) "Nov_Revenue",
    sum(case when d.month = 'Dec' then d.revenue else null end) "Dec_Revenue"
from department d
group by d.id
;
```

# Solution 2

```SQL
select
    d00.id,
    sum(d01.revenue) as "Jan_Revenue",
    sum(d02.revenue) as "Feb_Revenue",
    sum(d03.revenue) as "Mar_Revenue",
    sum(d04.revenue) as "Apr_Revenue",
    sum(d05.revenue) as "May_Revenue",
    sum(d06.revenue) as "Jun_Revenue",
    sum(d07.revenue) as "Jul_Revenue",
    sum(d08.revenue) as "Aug_Revenue",
    sum(d09.revenue) as "Sep_Revenue",
    sum(d10.revenue) as "Oct_Revenue",
    sum(d11.revenue) as "Nov_Revenue",
    sum(d12.revenue) as "Dec_Revenue"    
from (select distinct id from department) d00
left join department d01 on d01.id = d00.id and d01.month = 'Jan'
left join department d02 on d02.id = d00.id and d02.month = 'Feb'
left join department d03 on d03.id = d00.id and d03.month = 'Mar'
left join department d04 on d04.id = d00.id and d04.month = 'Apr'
left join department d05 on d05.id = d00.id and d05.month = 'May'
left join department d06 on d06.id = d00.id and d06.month = 'Jun'
left join department d07 on d07.id = d00.id and d07.month = 'Jul'
left join department d08 on d08.id = d00.id and d08.month = 'Aug'

solutions.title: reformat-department-table-pandas-easy-explained-step-by-step
solutions.content:
[see the successfully Accepted Submission](https://leetcode.com/submissions/detail/1053950222/)

```
import pandas as pd 

def reformat_table(department: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:

    # Initially, we pivot the table to have 'id' as the index, 'month' as columns, and 'revenue' as values
    pivot_table = department.pivot(index='id', columns='month', values='revenue')

    # In the next step, the list of all months is defined
    all_months = ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec']

    # Then, we add columns for all months, filling with NaN initially
    for month in all_months:
        if month not in pivot_table.columns:
            pivot_table[month] = np.nan

    # After that the columns to match the desired order are reordered
    pivot_table = pivot_table[all_months]

    # At the same time, the index to make 'id' a regular column are reset.
    pivot_table.reset_index(inplace=True)

    # Finally, the columns as requested are renamed.
    pivot_table.columns = ['id', 'Jan_Revenue', 'Feb_Revenue', 'Mar_Revenue', 'Apr_Revenue', 'May_Revenue', 'Jun_Revenue', 'Jul_Revenue', 'Aug_Revenue', 'Sep_Revenue', 'Oct_Revenue', 'Nov_Revenue', 'Dec_Revenue']
 
    return pivot_table

```

solutions.title: just-pivot-it
solutions.content:
USE PIVOT AND WILL BE FINISHED IN NO TIME  
```
/* Write your T-SQL query statement below */

SELECT
    ID AS id,
    JAN AS 'Jan_Revenue', FEB AS 'Feb_Revenue', MAR AS 'Mar_Revenue', APR AS 'Apr_Revenue', MAY AS 'May_Revenue', JUN AS 'Jun_Revenue', JUL AS 'Jul_Revenue',
    AUG AS 'Aug_Revenue', SEP AS 'Sep_Revenue', OCT AS 'Oct_Revenue', NOV AS 'Nov_Revenue', DEC AS 'Dec_Revenue'
FROM (
    SELECT
        *
    FROM
        DEPARTMENT
) A
PIVOT (
    SUM(REVENUE) FOR MONTH IN (JAN, FEB, MAR, APR, MAY, JUN, JUL, AUG, SEP, OCT, NOV, DEC)
) PVT
```

solutions.title: mysql-solution-easy-and-fast
solutions.content:
# Solution
```
SELECT 
       id,
       SUM(CASE WHEN month = 'Jan' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS 'Jan_Revenue',
       SUM(CASE WHEN month = 'Feb' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS 'Feb_Revenue',
       SUM(CASE WHEN month = 'Mar' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS 'Mar_Revenue',
       SUM(CASE WHEN month = 'Apr' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS 'Apr_Revenue',
       SUM(CASE WHEN month = 'May' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS 'May_Revenue',
       SUM(CASE WHEN month = 'Jun' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS 'Jun_Revenue',
       SUM(CASE WHEN month = 'Jul' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS 'Jul_Revenue',
       SUM(CASE WHEN month = 'Aug' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS 'Aug_Revenue',
       SUM(CASE WHEN month = 'Sep' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS 'Sep_Revenue',
       SUM(CASE WHEN month = 'Oct' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS 'Oct_Revenue',
       SUM(CASE WHEN month = 'Nov' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS 'Nov_Revenue',
       SUM(CASE WHEN month = 'Dec' THEN revenue ELSE null END) AS 'Dec_Revenue'
FROM Department
GROUP BY Id
```
The **CASE** statement goes through conditions and returns a value when the first condition is met (like an if-then-else statement). So, once a condition is true, it will stop reading and return the result. If no conditions are true, it returns the value in the ELSE clause.
If you find this **solution** and **explanation** helpful, please **upvote** it for others people.

solutions.title: my-brutal-force-solution-lol
solutions.content:
```
with
    Dept_Id as (select distinct id from Department),
    Jan_Revenue as (select id, revenue from Department where month='Jan'),
    Feb_Revenue as (select id, revenue from Department where month='Feb'),
    Mar_Revenue as (select id, revenue from Department where month='Mar'),
    Apr_Revenue as (select id, revenue from Department where month='Apr'),
    May_Revenue as (select id, revenue from Department where month='May'),
    Jun_Revenue as (select id, revenue from Department where month='Jun'),
    Jul_Revenue as (select id, revenue from Department where month='Jul'),
    Aug_Revenue as (select id, revenue from Department where month='Aug'),
    Sep_Revenue as (select id, revenue from Department where month='Sep'),
    Oct_Revenue as (select id, revenue from Department where month='Oct'),
    Nov_Revenue as (select id, revenue from Department where month='Nov'),
    Dec_Revenue as (select id, revenue from Department where month='Dec')
select
    d.id as id, 
    m1.revenue as 'Jan_Revenue',
    m2.revenue as 'Feb_Revenue',
    m3.revenue as 'Mar_Revenue',
    m4.revenue as 'Apr_Revenue',
    m5.revenue as 'May_Revenue',
    m6.revenue as 'Jun_Revenue',
    m7.revenue as 'Jul_Revenue',
    m8.revenue as 'Aug_Revenue',
    m9.revenue as 'Sep_Revenue',
    m10.revenue as 'Oct_Revenue',
    m11.revenue as 'Nov_Revenue',
    m12.revenue as 'Dec_Revenue'
from Dept_Id d
    left join Jan_Revenue m1 using (id)
    left join Feb_Revenue m2 using (id)
    left join Mar_Revenue m3 using (id)
    left join Apr_Revenue m4 using (id)
    left join May_Revenue m5 using (id)
    left join Jun_Revenue m6 using (id)
    left join Jul_Revenue m7 using (id)
    left join Aug_Revenue m8 using (id)
    left join Sep_Revenue m9 using (id)
    left join Oct_Revenue m10 using (id)
    left join Nov_Revenue m11 using (id)
    left join Dec_Revenue m12 using (id);
```

solutions.content:
I was basically trying to iterate the Jan to Dec columns using Group Concat function.
But it gets error at the first SELECT statement. 
Is it the case wehre LeetCode server does not allow more than 1 complete code ? (only one ";" allowed?)

```
SET @sql = NULL;

SELECT 
    GROUP_CONCAT
      (DISTINCT
        CONCAT('SUM(IF(MONTH =''',
                 month,
                  ''', REVENUE,NULL)) AS ',
                 month,
                  '_Revenue')
      ) INTO @sql
FROM Department;
  
SET @sql = CONCAT('SELECT id, ', 
                  @sql, ' 
                  FROM Department
                  GROUP BY id
                  ORDER BY id');

PREPARE stmt FROM @sql;
EXECUTE stmt;
DEALLOCATE PREPARE stmt;

```

# Write your MySQL query statement below
select d0.id as id,
       d1.Revenue as Jan_Revenue,
       d2.Revenue as Feb_Revenue,
       d3.Revenue as Mar_Revenue,
       d4.Revenue as Apr_Revenue,
       d5.Revenue as May_Revenue,
       d6.Revenue as Jun_Revenue,
       d7.Revenue as Jul_Revenue,

       d9.Revenue as Sep_Revenue,
       d10.Revenue as Oct_Revenue,

solutions.title: solution-for-mysql
solutions.content:
```
select 
	id,
	sum(Jan_Revenue) as Jan_Revenue,
	sum(Feb_Revenue) as Feb_Revenue,
	sum(Mar_Revenue) as Mar_Revenue,
	sum(Apr_Revenue) as Apr_Revenue,
	sum(May_Revenue) as May_Revenue,
	sum(Jun_Revenue) as Jun_Revenue,
	sum(Jul_Revenue) as Jul_Revenue,
	sum(Aug_Revenue) as Aug_Revenue,
	sum(Sep_Revenue) as Sep_Revenue,
	sum(Oct_Revenue) as Oct_Revenue,
	sum(Nov_Revenue) as Nov_Revenue,
	sum(Dec_Revenue) as Dec_Revenue
from (
    select
        department.*,
        case when month = 'Jan' then revenue end as 'Jan_Revenue',
        case when month = 'Feb' then revenue end as 'Feb_Revenue',
        case when month = 'Mar' then revenue end as 'Mar_Revenue',
        case when month = 'Apr' then revenue end as 'Apr_Revenue',

) tbl
group by id;

solutions.title: oracle-decode
solutions.content:
It's possible to use *DECODE* instead of *CASE*:
```
select
id, 
MAX(decode(month,'Jan',revenue)) Jan_Revenue,
MAX(decode(month,'Feb',revenue)) Feb_Revenue,
MAX(decode(month,'Mar',revenue)) Mar_Revenue,
MAX(decode(month,'Apr',revenue)) Apr_Revenue,
MAX(decode(month,'May',revenue)) May_Revenue,
MAX(decode(month,'Jun',revenue)) Jun_Revenue,
MAX(decode(month,'Jul',revenue)) Jul_Revenue,
MAX(decode(month,'Aug',revenue)) Aug_Revenue,
MAX(decode(month,'Sep',revenue)) Sep_Revenue,
MAX(decode(month,'Oct',revenue)) Oct_Revenue,
MAX(decode(month,'Nov',revenue)) Nov_Revenue,
MAX(decode(month,'Dec',revenue)) Dec_Revenue
from Department
group by id
```
*MAX* is used because there are no pairs with the same id and month (PK = id, month)

        [Jan] as Jan_Revenue,[Feb] as Feb_Revenue,[Mar] as Mar_Revenue,[Apr] as Apr_Revenue,

```
SELECT "id",
        SUM("Jan_Revenue") "Jan_Revenue", 
        SUM("Feb_Revenue") "Feb_Revenue",

        SUM("Apr_Revenue") "Apr_Revenue",

solutions.title: ms-sql-pivot-table
solutions.content:
```

with cte as(
	select id
			,revenue
			,case month 
				when 'Jan' then 'Jan_Revenue'
				when 'Feb' then 'Feb_Revenue'
				when 'Mar' then 'Mar_Revenue'
				when 'Apr' then 'Apr_Revenue'
				when 'May' then 'May_Revenue'
				when 'Jun' then 'Jun_Revenue'
				when 'Jul' then 'Jul_Revenue'
				when 'Aug' then 'Aug_Revenue'
				when 'Sep' then 'Sep_Revenue'
				when 'Oct' then 'Oct_Revenue'
				when 'Nov' then 'Nov_Revenue'
				when 'Dec' then 'Dec_Revenue'
				else month end 
			 as Month_
	from Department
)
select * from cte
pivot
(sum(revenue)
for Month_ in 
([Jan_Revenue], [Feb_Revenue],[Mar_Revenue],[Apr_Revenue],[May_Revenue],[Jun_Revenue],[Jul_Revenue],[Aug_Revenue],[Sep_Revenue],[Oct_Revenue],[Nov_Revenue],[Dec_Revenue])
) as pvt

solutions.title: ms-sql-using-pivot-faster-than-96-58
solutions.content:
```
SELECT id, 
       [Jan] AS Jan_Revenue, 
       [Feb] AS Feb_Revenue, 
       [Mar] AS Mar_Revenue, 
       [Apr] AS Apr_Revenue,
       [May] AS May_Revenue,
       [Jun] AS Jun_Revenue,
       [Jul] AS Jul_Revenue,
       [Aug] AS Aug_Revenue,
       [Sep] AS Sep_Revenue,
       [Oct] AS Oct_Revenue,
       [Nov] AS Nov_Revenue,
       [Dec] AS Dec_Revenue
FROM
(SELECT Id, revenue, month FROM Department) AS p
    PIVOT  
        (  
            SUM(revenue)
            FOR month IN  
            (  [Jan],
               [Feb],
               [Mar],
               [Apr],
               [May],
               [Jun],
               [Jul],
               [Aug],
               [Sep],
               [Oct],
               [Nov],
               [Dec] 
            )  
        ) AS pvt
ORDER BY pvt.ID
```

SELECT DISTINCT D.id,
(SELECT SUM(revenue) FROM Department J WHERE J.month = 'Jan' AND D.id = J.id) AS Jan_Revenue,
(SELECT SUM(revenue) FROM Department J WHERE J.month = 'Feb' AND D.id = J.id) AS Feb_Revenue,
(SELECT SUM(revenue) FROM Department J WHERE J.month = 'Mar' AND D.id = J.id) AS Mar_Revenue,

solutions.title: wonder-if-there-is-an-easier-and-faster-solution
solutions.content:
```

SELECT id,
       SUM(jan) AS Jan_Revenue,
       SUM(feb) AS Feb_Revenue,
       SUM(mar) AS Mar_Revenue,
       SUM(apr) AS Apr_Revenue,
       SUM(may) AS May_Revenue,
       SUM(jun) AS Jun_Revenue,
       SUM(jul) AS Jul_Revenue,
       SUM(aug) AS Aug_Revenue,
       SUM(sep) AS Sep_Revenue,
       SUM(oct) AS Oct_Revenue,
       SUM(nov) AS Nov_Revenue,
       SUM(decm) AS Dec_Revenue
FROM (
         SELECT id,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Jan' THEN revenue END AS jan,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Feb' THEN revenue END AS feb,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Mar' THEN revenue END AS mar,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Apr' THEN revenue END AS apr,
                CASE WHEN month = 'May' THEN revenue END AS may,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Jun' THEN revenue END AS jun,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Jul' THEN revenue END AS jul,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Aug' THEN revenue END AS aug,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Sep' THEN revenue END AS sep,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Oct' THEN revenue END AS oct,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Nov' THEN revenue END AS nov,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Dec' THEN revenue END AS decm
         FROM department
     ) AS X
GROUP BY id
ORDER BY id
```

       SUM(mar) AS Mar_Revenue,
       SUM(apr) AS Apr_Revenue,
       SUM(may) AS May_Revenue,
       SUM(jun) AS Jun_Revenue,
       SUM(jul) AS Jul_Revenue,
       SUM(aug) AS Aug_Revenue,
       SUM(sep) AS Sep_Revenue,
       SUM(oct) AS Oct_Revenue,
       SUM(nov) AS Nov_Revenue,
       SUM(decm) AS Dec_Revenue
FROM (
         SELECT id,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Jan' THEN revenue END AS jan,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Feb' THEN revenue END AS feb,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Mar' THEN revenue END AS mar,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Apr' THEN revenue END AS apr,
                CASE WHEN month = 'May' THEN revenue END AS may,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Jun' THEN revenue END AS jun,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Jul' THEN revenue END AS jul,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Aug' THEN revenue END AS aug,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Sep' THEN revenue END AS sep,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Oct' THEN revenue END AS oct,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Nov' THEN revenue END AS nov,
                CASE WHEN month = 'Dec' THEN revenue END AS decm
         FROM department
     ) AS X
GROUP BY id
ORDER BY id
```

solutions.title: pandas-succint-code-callendar-pivot-and-concat
solutions.content:
# Intuition
This question is perfect example of getting familiar with pivoting:
What is pivoting? It's no more, no less, than turning your table by 90$^{\circ}$ by one of columns, resulting in new table that has columns that were previously rows of this chosen column.
Read about it here: [pandas.DataFrame.pivot](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.pivot.html) or [pandas.pivot_table](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.pivot_table.html).
Here we gonna use simple pivot.

# Approach
First we have to pivot our original table. It's as simple as:
```
department.pivot(index='id',columns='month',values='revenue')
```
We specify:
1. index = our new rows
2. columns = our column to pivot on - it's values will now be columns, so in this example: `Jan`,`Feb`,`Mar`.... etc.
3. values = new values of our table.

Since our task is to have `Jan_Revenue`, `Feb_Revenue`.. etc as our column name, we can use `.add_suffix('_Revenue')` on table - it does exactly what is says : adding suffix to columns. Finally we want to reset index - since we need it as one of our columns - its important that we resetting this index after adding suffix, so it's stays the same as it was originally.


Second part of our task is to create some frame for our pivoted table:
1. pivoted tables tend to have columns in alphabetical order, here we want month order.
2. pivoted table dont have to have all months we need

For Monhts we can use callendar module and `callendar.month_abbr` atribute, to get 3 letter representation of month names.

```
| id | Jan_Revenue | Feb_Revenue | Mar_Revenue | Apr_Revenue | May_Revenue | Jun_Revenue | Jul_Revenue | Aug_Revenue | Sep_Revenue | Oct_Revenue | Nov_Revenue | Dec_Revenue |
| -- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- |
```
Finally just use `pd.concat` to put one table on top of other. The order of column will be kept from first table, so thats were we use our empty DataFrame with all months.

# Code
```
import pandas as pd
import calendar
def reformat_table(department: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    columns =  pd.DataFrame(columns = ['id'] + [calendar.month_abbr[i] + '_Revenue' for i in range(1,13)])
    department = department.pivot(index='id',columns='month',values='revenue').add_suffix('_Revenue').reset_index()
    return pd.concat([columns, department])
```

| id | Jan_Revenue | Feb_Revenue | Mar_Revenue | Apr_Revenue | May_Revenue | Jun_Revenue | Jul_Revenue | Aug_Revenue | Sep_Revenue | Oct_Revenue | Nov_Revenue | Dec_Revenue |
| -- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- | ----------- |
```

```

import pandas as pd

def reformat_table(department: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    df = department.pivot(index='id', columns='month', values='revenue').add_suffix('_Revenue').reset_index()

    new_columns = ['id'] + [f"{month}_Revenue" for month in ["Jan", "Feb", "Mar", "Apr", "May", "Jun", "Jul", "Aug", "Sep", "Oct", "Nov", "Dec"]]
    df = df.reindex(columns=new_columns)

    return df
```

solutions.title: pandas-with-explanation
solutions.content:
# Code
```
import pandas as pd

def reformat_table(department: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    # define columns
    cols = ['Jan_Revenue', 'Feb_Revenue', 'Mar_Revenue', 'Apr_Revenue', 'May_Revenue', 'Jun_Revenue', 'Jul_Revenue', 'Aug_Revenue', 'Sep_Revenue', 'Oct_Revenue', 'Nov_Revenue', 'Dec_Revenue']
    # pivot table as needed
    department = department.sort_values(by='id').pivot(index='id', columns='month', values='revenue').add_suffix('_Revenue').reset_index()
    # we have a lack of months, so we need to add special columns
    for col in cols:
        if col not in department:
            department[col] = np.nan
    return department[['id'] + cols]
```
solutions.code:
```
import pandas as pd

def reformat_table(department: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    # define columns
    cols = ['Jan_Revenue', 'Feb_Revenue', 'Mar_Revenue', 'Apr_Revenue', 'May_Revenue', 'Jun_Revenue', 'Jul_Revenue', 'Aug_Revenue', 'Sep_Revenue', 'Oct_Revenue', 'Nov_Revenue', 'Dec_Revenue']
    # pivot table as needed
    department = department.sort_values(by='id').pivot(index='id', columns='month', values='revenue').add_suffix('_Revenue').reset_index()
    # we have a lack of months, so we need to add special columns
    for col in cols:
        if col not in department:
            department[col] = np.nan
    return department[['id'] + cols]
```
